3 mm crochet hook - approx 40x40 cm of off-white thick fabric that doesn t fray too easily for 2x2 pages more if you want more pages in the baby- book - a sheet or two of iron-on transfer paper to print pics on depending on the number of photos you plan to print - pinking shears - one little sleigh bell to put inside rattle toy - darning needle to weave in ends and embroider kitty s whiskers - polyfill to stuff rattle toy gauge - 10 cm = 4 =24 st and 26 row in single_crochet single_crochet - 10 cm = 4 =27 st and 11 row in double_crochet in front loop dcfl size cardigan is sized for a 6-12 months baby baby-book is approx 15 x 17cm abbreviations chain= chain slip_stitch= slip_stitch lp= loop st=stitch single_crochet= single_crochet double_crochet= double_crochet yo= yarn over fo= fasten_off dcfl= double_crochet in front loop * *= repeat sequence between stars decrease= single_crochet 2 together = decrease mc= main color used here for anemone/purple cc= contrasting color used here for kiwi/green stitches used - chain single_crochet double_crochet in front loop - spike cluster derived from « birdsfoot spikes » on page 193 of « the crochet stitch bible » by betty barnden insert hook to right of single_crochet 2 row below and 1 st to right of next single_crochet yo pull loop through insert hook to right of single_crochet 2 row below next single_crochet yo pull loop through insert hook to right of single_crochet 2 row below and 1 st to left lengthen all these loops so the work lies flat yo pull through 4 loops on hook - spike cluster edging *5sc along edge of work 1 spike cluster* -note every single_crochet row starts with ch1 and every dcfl row with ch2 cardigan back with kiwi cc ch65 ch2 dcfl across row for 2 row cut yarn switch to anemone mc join yarn and work 12 row in dcfl at 14 cm high start armhole shaping work first 4 st in slip_stitch ch3 work in dcfl until 4 last st turn 47 st remaining work those 57 st even for next 10 row until piece measures 24 cm at 24 cm shape neck ch2 work 18st in dcfl turn next 2 row skip 1 st at neck edge fasten_off remaining 16 st cut yarn work second side of neck likewise left front with kiwi cc ch33 turn ch2 dcfl across row for 2 row cut yarn switch to anemone mc join yarn and work 12 row in dcfl at 14 cm high start armhole shaping
